meanings.def: going straight up or down from a level surface or from top to bottom in a picture, etc.
examples: the vertical axis of the graph
There was a vertical drop to the ocean.

meanings.def: having a structure in which there are top, middle and bottom levels
passed from one generation to the next
examples: 4% of these infections result from vertical transmission from mother to baby.

meanings.def: a straight line or position from top to bottom or bottom to top
examples: The wall is several degrees off the vertical.

meanings.def: an area of business or field of activity
examples: This year we saw significant growth outside our core verticals.
Can you identify different verticals in your market to which your product might also appeal?
We had actually identified the healthcare industry as a vertical we wanted to enter way back in 2004.
